DataElement.preferredName: Epidermis Genetic Testing Diagnostic Procedure Anatomic Site Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the location on the body from which a diagnostic procedure was performed for genetic/pathologic analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Epidermis Genetic Testing Diagnostic Procedure Anatomic Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to anatomic location (an anatomical position, site, or point) and a diagnostic procedure (methods and/or tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability) using the epidermis (the epithelial portion of the skin) for genetic testing (analyzing DNA to look for a genetic alteration that may indicate an increased risk for developing a specific disease or disorder).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The epithelial portion of the skin (cutis). It consists of the following layers: stratum corneum (horny layer), stratum granulosum (granular layer), stratum spinosum (prickle cell layer), and stratum basale (basal cell layer).:Analyzing DNA to look for a genetic alteration that may indicate an increased risk for developing a specific disease or disorder.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: The epithelial portion of the skin (cutis). It consists of the following layers: stratum corneum (horny layer), stratum granulosum (granular layer), stratum spinosum (prickle cell layer), and stratum basale (basal cell layer).
The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to anatomy.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

DataElement.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form
